reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Ok, so the Belsana is a 3 star, it knows it's a 3 star and doesn't try to be anything other than a 3 star. My partner Linda and I arrived home yesterday,20th, after spending a week at the Belsana, Linda is wheat and gluten intolerant so the food on offer was not too good for her, but she muddled through in salads and fish. Yes the drinks are served in plastic cups but one dropped glass would be dangerous on the terrace/pool area. We went to Porto for a restful week and that is just what we got, a leisurely 10 minute walk to the beach every day and no reps trying to sell you a trip every other day. All in all a great holiday, with relaxation aplenty. We would go again.
reviews.title: It is a 3 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the numerous 'negative reviews' before we went, we were left thinking 'oh well, lets just make the best of it!' ....we were pleasantly suprised!!
reviews.title: Don't believe all you read !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Yes, we booked to make the transfer with 'Resort Hopper' and in our view this was the only negative of the whole holiday. Yes, the transfer does take 2 hours (longer for some on return journey...depending on when your picked up!). From airport to hotel actually took 3 hours as we had to sit on coach for an hour waiting for a 'delayed flight' . Speaking with other people who used this service on other days this was a common excuse. Reality is, its a cheap transfer and they want to cram as many people on one coach for one journey...lesson learnt there!!
reviews.title: Me, Us (NEVER, say never)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The HOTEL is small, (approx 50 rooms), very clean, with friendly helpful staff. The food did become a little repetitive by end of week no one went hungry. The meat dishes comprised of varieties of fish, pork and chicken dishes. There were chips every day ...but i never felt the need to fill up on them. There was also a variety of salad dishes each day. The bread was always warm & fresh. Desserts were repetitive but numerous enough to provide variety.
reviews.title: GREAT HOLIDAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Breakfast had a choice of full cooked range (proper sausages !), toast, cereal, Tea & coffee, fruit juice ...and the fresh warm croissants were gorgeous. Every meal also had a fruit option.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Travelled to the hotel with the NHSRF group and Della Holidays. Hotel was only 45 mins from the airport in the evening, though a longer journey by coach on return.
reviews.title: Value for money and quiet friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The week's stay was during the last week of the season in October but the staff were very attentive and the choice of food very good. There was even food prepared at 9 pm on the day of arrival. A free bar each day was a bonus and although the wine was not top quality, spirits and beer were fine, especially as included. Our room on the fourth floor was clean, with towels and soap etc certainly up to 3 star standard. The view from the balcony was over the harbour entrance and sunrise each day a splendour.
reviews.title: Amazing All-Inclusive Holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a swimming pool on a terrace overlooking the sea which could be planted up
reviews.title: Very good budget hol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: to improve, but the land between the sea and the hotel is public and cannot be built on in any way.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff/Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinking water was best bought and used for tea etc. [take your own kettle] as the local supply is desalinated but still salty to taste.
reviews.title: Do your homework before you go?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner booked to stay in the Belsana through teletext holidays. This hotel was situated in a small fishin villiage called Porto Colom. We were looking for 4 nights away in the sunshine to do nothing but eat, sunbathe and enjoy a relaxing holiday away from on it all.
reviews.title: Lovely break away - ignore the poor reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff could not do enough for you, we had a problem with our room and within an hour ti was changed for us no question. The All Inclusive food range was very good and tasty, no complaints at all.
reviews.title: wicked, relaxing holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are basic, hotel grounds are clean and the view from the swimming pool is lovely looking over the cliffs into the see.
reviews.title: Don't know what the bad reviews are talking about!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't go here if you are looking to party but I would definitely recommend this resort if you are looking for a relaxing time away with good service and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Airport transfer for approx 60 minutes, this could be longer depending on the amount of hotel pick ups and drop offs.
reviews.title: Everyone has an opinion, but you have to see for yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Back 4 days now from a 10 day stay and have mixed feelings about the Belsana. Firstly, the good bits, brilliant staff, very clean, fabulous views, lovely quiet resort and plenty of room round pool. Also plenty of hot water and good air conditioning.
reviews.title: A shame, could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly, the bad bits, the food was not really up to standard. My husband and I are by no means fussy eaters but on a couple of occasions we struggled to find a decent meal. On a lot of occasions I had a cheese sandwich (the bread was lovely). Instead of looking forward to our meal we were apprehensive. Several times food reappeared in a different guise. We wondered if the low standard was due to the fact the hotel only has a week before it closes until May??
reviews.title: same as others dont listen to bad reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe they were clearing out the freezer? Not good enough.
reviews.title: Great Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other bad bits include, only one bar open at a time, so if you wanted a drink in the day time you had to go up to the pool (no lift), no menu for the pool snacks, coffee served in plastic glasses(!) and a few comfy chairs in the bar wouldn't go amiss.
reviews.title: Stunning Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To sum up, if the food had been better the holiday would have been better.
reviews.title: "Please ignore the bad reviews - fabulous holiday"
